title: coconut_tree
body: A type of [[palm tree]] that [[coconut|coconuts]] grow on.

title: coconut
body:
The [[fruit]] of the [[coconut tree|coconut palm]]. It has a hard brown shell, which holds edible white flesh; the liquid inside the cavity is called coconut milk. The entire fruit is covered by a fibrous outer husk which is usually removed before the coconut is further processed.

Coconuts vary in appearance, ranging from having a smooth green shell, to a yellow one, and of course the common brown color that is covered in bark strips.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: cauliflower
body:
A type of vegetable with a white growth of edible stalks, although other colors are seen such as orange, green, and even purple. Cauliflower and [[broccoli]] both belong to the genus [i]Brassica oleracea[/i].

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: vitruvian_man
body:

The drawing is based on the correlations of ideal human proportions with geometry described by the ancient Roman architect Vitruvius in Book III of his treatise De Architectura. [b]-Wikipedia-[/b]

title: yamashita_satoru
body:
A male character of [[Kurogane no Linebarrel]].

In the manga he is introduced using the Japanese pronoun for 'he' which is, 'kare' appears in Hiragana next to the kanji for 'he' or 'him'; "そして彼が (Soshite kare ga) Yamashita Satoru-kun da." This can be found in the original Japanese manga, Volume 2, page 86. Additionally, "Satoru" is traditionally a masculine name in Japan.

The Wikipedia article (in the Manga/Anime ring) does refer to Yamashita as a girl. However, this mistake was based on an English scanlation of the manga that has proliferated on the Internet. (Info taken from Myanimelist.net)

title: persona_x_detective
body:
From the "Megami Tensei Wiki":http://megamitensei.wikia.com/wiki/Persona_x_Detective

[quote]Persona X Detective is a spin-off of the video game Shin Megami Tensei: [[Persona 4]] released on the PlayStation 2 in 2008. It stars one of the Major Characters of that game, [[shirogane_naoto|Naoto Shirogane]], as the main character, who at the time of this novel is a 16-17 year old police detective.

It takes place one year after the events of Persona 4 and features Naoto in a brand new town with a brand new school. While there she deals with the mystery of a bunch of recent disappearances.[/quote]

This tag should only be used when the content of the picture displays elements specifically from the novel.

title: long_live_the_queen
body:
Long Live The Queen is a visual novel role-playing video game developed by Hanako Games and Spiky Caterpillar, published by Hanako Games. 

The story of the game follows a [[elodie|young princess]] who is training to become queen after the death of her mother. The objective of the game is to keep the princess alive for 40 weeks until she turns 15 and is crowned.

title: kanchuumimai
body:
寒中見舞い ([i]kanchuumimai[/i], midwinter greetings) or 寒中お見舞い ([i]kanchuu o-mimai[/i]) are postcards that people in Japan send to friends during mid winter. They typically contain the phrase "寒中(お)見舞い申し上げます" ([i]kanchuu (o-)mimai moushi agemasu[/i]).

Unlike [[shochuumimai]], kanchuumimai are often used as substitutes of [[nengajou]].
When you were not able to send nengajou during New Year holidays for some reason, or when you received 喪中欠礼 ([i]mochuu ketsurei[/i]) from one of your friends, they will be sent.
([i]Mochuu ketsurei[/i] means "Please forgive me not sending you New Year greetings. Obeying Japanese custom, I shall refrain from offering you New Year's greetings while in mourning.")

See also

* [[nengajou]]
* [[shochuumimai]] (mid summer)
* [[zanshomimai]] (late summer)

title: brazuca
body:
The official match [[soccer ball]] for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] designed by [[Adidas]]. Made of six polyurethane panels bonded thermically, the ball is mostly white with multi-colored bands that represent Brazil.

The name comes from the slang term for a Brazilian (person) and has come to represent the Brazilian diaspora in general. The name was also chosen by popular vote, garnering 77.8% of the votes.

title: roberta_(black_lagoon)
body: [b]Roberta[/b] is the head maid of the Lovelace family, one of the thirteen richest families of South America. She is very dedicated to her master Diego Lovelace and her young master Garcia. She is also one of the deadliest women alive, and used to be known as [b]Rosarita Cisneros[/b], the "Bloodhound of Florencia," a military-trained assassin who used to work for FARC and was a very cold-blooded killer who is now seeking to atone for her sins. She is one of the few characters of [[Black Lagoon]] capable of matching [[revy_(black_lagoon)|Revy]] herself gun for gun.

title: balalaika_(black_lagoon)
body:
In [[Black Lagoon]], [b]Balalaika[/b] represents the branch of the Russian Mafia known as Hotel Moscow and is one of the Lagoon Company's primary employers. A former captain of the Russian Airborne Corps and veteran of the Afghanistan War, Balalaika and her men are hardened soldiers who are more than ready to tackle just about anything that comes their way.

The scar down the right side of her face from a grenade blast during a battle has led to the derisive nickname "Fry Face" among the gangsters of Roanapur, but only a fool dares to call her this to her face. Balalaika's sheer ruthlessness and dedication make getting on her bad side one of the worst mistakes one can ever make.

h6. Not to be confused with

* The [[balalaika_(instrument)|musical instrument]]

title: benny_(black_lagoon)
body: In [[Black Lagoon]], Benny is the Lagoon Company's primary communications expert and electronics whiz. Born from a Jewish family, he worked in a university in Florida before running foul of both the FBI and the Mafia and having to leave the country before he got himself killed. Like [[Okajima Rokuro|Rock]], Benny doesn't get into the violence that [[revy_(black_lagoon)|Revy]] and [[dutch_(black_lagoon)|Dutch]] often get into, preferring to run mission control aboard the title ship and get the crew out of danger.

title: dutch_(black_lagoon)
body: Dutch is the leader of the Lagoon Company and the captain of the [[Black Lagoon]], a modified PT boat with all the weapons removed except for the torpedo tubes. Dutch stays cool no matter how bad things may get. His background includes military service, including a tour in Vietnam.

title: kuroino_(poco)
body:
An original "character" created by [[poco_(asahi_age)|Poco]].
An mysterious, undying living creature, Kuroino is frequently seen with, and nearly as often abused by, [[shiratama_kitsune|Shiratama Kitsune]], though it is by no means exempt from this treatment from the others. It mysteriously revives each time, however, be it from being smashed by a steamroller to be used as an umbrella, to being eaten by a giant fish, to being cooked by Tsutsune.

title: cure_muse_(yellow)
body:
[[Shirabe Ako]]'s Precure form. She is able to create a rainbow piano and shoot the keys at enemies to pin them long enough to purify them, and can create a barrier to protect others from the Melody of Sorrow.

This tag is for Cure Muse's unveiled form. For her masked form, use [[cure muse (black)]].

title: cure_muse_(black)
body:
[[Shirabe Ako]]'s former Precure form before episode 35. She keeps her identity and motives secret until then, though she has a Cure Module and is accompanied by the purple [[Fairy Tone]] Dodory.

This tag is for Cure Muse's masked form. For her unveiled form, use [[cure muse (yellow)]].

title: shirabe_ako
body: [[Suite Precure]] character. She has short blonde/orange hair, wears glasses and is a student of Public Kanon Elementery School. She is [[Minamino Souta]]'s classmate. She transforms into [[cure muse (yellow)|Cure Muse]].

title: cure_beat
body:
Magical girl form of [[seiren (suite precure)|Seiren]]/[[Kurokawa Eren]] in [[Suite Precure]]. Has long purple hair tied into a [[side ponytail]] and a blue outfit.

For images regarding the fake Cure Beat rumors spread before Eren's reveal, see [[Cure Beat (fake)]].

title: kurokawa_eren
body: A character from [[Suite Precure]]. She is the human form of [[seiren_(suite_precure)|Seiren]], has long [[purple hair]] with [[one side up]] ponytail. She can transform into [[Cure Beat]].

title: aphrodite_(suite_precure)
body: [[Suite Precure]] character. The queen of Major Land who scatters the notes of the Melody of Happiness for the Precure to protect from [[mephisto (suite precure)|Mephisto]] and his forces.

title: bassdrum
body: [[Suite Precure]] character. One of the members of Trio the Minor who has green hair and a beard.

title: cure_humming
body: A fan name for [[hummy (suite precure)|Hummy]] from [[Suite Precure]] when she is [[personification|personified]] and becomes a [[Precure]]. It never happens in the series, so there are various interpretations for Cure Humming's appearance.

title: hummy_(suite_precure)
body: A cat fairy in [[Suite Precure]] who grants [[Houjou Hibiki]] and [[Minamino Kanade]] the ability to transform into [[Cure Melody]] and [[Cure Rhythm]] respectively. Interestingly, Hummy is voiced by [[Mitsuishi Kotono]], who also voiced [[Sailor Moon]] in the past. She also gets her powers from a talking cat.

body: [[Suite Precure]] character. One of the members of Trio the Minor who has pink hair.

title: houjou_maria
body: [[Suite Precure]] character. [[Houjou Hibiki]]'s mother.

title: houjou_sakura
body: One of [[seiren (suite precure)|Seiren]]'s forms she briefly uses in order to get close to [[houjou hibiki|Hibiki]] and cause [[minamino kanade|Kanade]] to become jealous.

title: minamino_misora
body: [[Suite Precure]] character. [[minamino kanade|Kanade]] and [[minamino souta|Souta]]'s mother.

title: minamino_souta
body: [[Suite Precure]] character. [[Minamino Kanade]]'s younger brother.

title: suzu_(suite_precure)
body: [[Suite Precure]] character. [[Shirabe Ako]]'s friend from Major Land in the Suite Precure movie.

title: higashiyama_seika
body: [[Suite Precure]] character. She has shoulder-length blonde hair, brown eyes, wears a ponytail, a senior and the president of Sweets Club in which [[Minamino Kanade]] is a member. Some believed she would become [[Cure Symphony]], but this never happened.

title: nishijima_waon
body: [[Suite Precure]] character. She has short blue hair, blue eyes, a classmate and sport friend of [[Houjou Hibiki]]. Many believed she would become [[cure beat (fake)|Cure Beat]], but this was proven false.

title: cure_symphony
body: A fake Precure created for [[Suite Precure]] in a very blurry version of post #1069213. Some viewers believed that [[Higashiyama Seika]] would become Cure Symphony, but this has been proven false. This Cure Symphony's civilian name was [[Toudou Koto]].

title: aoki_reika
body: The blue-haired girl in [[Smile Precure!]] who serves as the Student Council's vice president. She transforms into [[Cure Beauty]].

title: hoshizora_miyuki
body: The pink-haired girl in [[Smile Precure!]] who loves fairy tales and is very cheerful and optimistic. She transforms into [[Cure Happy]].

title: kise_yayoi
body: The blonde-haired girl in [[Smile Precure!]] who is a bit of a crybaby but is an overachiever and loves drawing manga. She transforms into [[Cure Peace]].

title: majorina
body:
One of Pierrot's subordinates in [[smile precure!|Smile Precure]], based on the witches of Hansel and Gretel and Snow White, the "Majo" part of her name taken from the Japanese word for 'witch'. She's short and cruel and is often making various magical inventions to use against the Cures, usually with poor naming sense. While her normal appearance is of a short, ugly old witch, she can transform into a tall and attractive young woman. Majorina is usually pitted against [[Midorikawa Nao]]/[[Cure March]].

h4.See also

* [[Majorin]]

title: cure_echo
body: The Pretty Cure alter ego of [[Sakagami Ayumi]].

title: aida_mana
body: The lead character in [[DokiDoki! Precure]]. Mana is the Student Council President of her school.  She excels in academics, is extremely athletic, and loves helping people. She transforms into [[Cure Heart]] and is voiced by [[Nabatame Hitomi]].

title: cure_diamond
body: The Pretty Cure alter-ego of [[Hishikawa Rikka]], who wears blue. She is named after the playing card suit.

title: hishikawa_rikka
body: One of the protagonists in [[DokiDoki! Precure]] who is [[Aida Mana]]'s childhood friend and always tries to keep Mana out of trouble, even though she wants to live a quiet life. She transforms into [[Cure Diamond]] and is voiced by [[Kotobuki Minako]].

title: cure_sword
body: The Pretty Cure alter-ego of [[Kenzaki Makoto]], who wears purple. Her Cure name refers to the former playing card symbol before it was replaced with the spade.

title: kenzaki_makoto
body: One of the protagonists in [[DokiDoki! Precure]], who is separated from the Trump Kingdom's princess and fights alone as [[Cure Sword]] to find her. As a civilian, Makoto is a super idol and fashionista. She is voiced by [[Miyamoto Kanako]].

title: cure_rosetta
body: The Pretty Cure alter-ego of [[Yotsuba Alice]], who wears yellow and has brown hair done in twintails and [[double bun]]s. Her Cure name is the Italian word for [[rose]], since the rose was used as a playing card symbol before being replaced with the club.

title: yotsuba_alice
body: One of the protagonists in [[DokiDoki! Precure]] who is the heiress of a large business conglomerate, and has been raised to be multi-talented. She transforms into [[Cure Rosetta]] and is voiced by [[Fuchigami Mai]].

title: oomori_yuuko
body: [[HappinessCharge Precure!]] character. Civilian identity of [[Cure Honey]].

title: miguel_caballero_rojo
other_names: ミゲル・カバジェロ・ロホ

title: lars_alexandersson
body:
The main protagonist of [[Tekken 6]]. Partnered with his android fellow [[Alisa Boskonovich]] to restore his memory only for Alisa to turn on him after realizing that her actual motive is to serve the Mishima Zaibatsu and its CEO [[Kazama Jin]].

He later gains another partner, a [[ninja]] who is also a secret agent under the codename of [[Raven (Tekken)|Raven]], to stop Azazel and Jin for good.
other_names: ラース・アレクサンダーソン

title: sergei_dragunov
body:
[i]Russian: Серге́й Драгунов[/i]
[[Tekken]] character.

He is the commander of a Russian military army that seeks to study the Devil Gene. His soldiers have nicknamed him as the "White Angel of Death".

He does not talk but he only does grunts and kiais in battle. His fighting style is sambo.
other_names: セルゲイ・ドラグノフ

title: mishima_jinpachi
body:
[[Tekken]] character.

He was the original CEO of the Mishima Zaibatsu until his son [[Mishima Heihachi|Heihachi]] imprisoned him under Honmaru for years, thus passing the title of Zaibatsu CEO to Heihachi.

It wasn't until [[Tekken 5]] when Jinpachi freed himself from the chains that imprison him under Honmaru and reclaimed the title of Zaibatsu CEO, when Heihachi is rumored to be dead by an unknown secret agent who uses [[Raven (Tekken)|Raven]] as a codename.

He was eventually defeated by [[Kazama Jin]], thus passing the title of Zaibatsu CEO to Jin prior to [[Tekken 6]].

title: feng_wei
body:
A character from the Tekken series of games produced by Namco (later Namco Bandai).

He is a Chinese Kenpo criminal accused of destroying dojos around the world, even to the extend of stealing [[Kazama Asuka]]'s dojo sign. Little does he know is that he is trying to learn the secrets behind the Scroll of the Dragon Fist.

His appearance and fighting style is an homage to the Chinese actor and martial artist [[Jet Li]].

title: nina_williams
body: Irish female fighter from the Tekken series of fighting games. The older of the Williams siblings in the series, she is her sister, Anna's, eternal rival. An assassin by profession and involuntary mother of fellow Tekken fighter Steve Fox. Underwent a cryogenic sleep between Tekken 2 and 3, allowing her to stay young in the years between (almost twenty). At first is amnesic after being awoken, she eventually regains her memories. Starred in her own game called Death by Degrees.
other_names: ニーナ・ウィリアムズ

title: michelle_chang
body:
[[Tekken]] character.

The adoptive mother of [[Julia Chang]], and the daughter of an old Arizona land owner whose pendant was stolen by [[Mishima Kazuya]].

title: marshall_law
body:
A character from the [[Tekken]] series of games.

He is an American chef who works at a Chinese restaurant and is a master of Jeet Kune Do.

His appearance and fighting style is an homage to the deceased Chinese actor and martial artist [[Bruce Lee]].

title: anna_williams
body: Female fighter from the Tekken series of fighting games. Younger sister of [[Nina Williams]] but is in almost constant conflict with her. Underwent a cryogenic sleep for twenty years, allowing her to retain her youthful appearance in Tekken 3 and onwards.

Cure Mint is the first of two green Precures in the entire series, with [[Cure March]] as the second.

title: brigadoon
body:
BRIGADOON まりんとメラン, lit. [i]Brigadoon: Marin and Melan[/i] is a 26 episode science fiction anime that ran from 2000–2001, produced by the Sunrise company , and was adapted as a manga by Nozomi Watase. title: mine_fujiko
body: The only female member of [[Arsene Lupin III]]'s posse, Fujiko is a classic femme fatale who has no problem betraying Lupin so she can steal something valuable. She is excellent with espionage and flirting with her enemies to get what she wants, but she tends to get captured often. Lupin is head over heels for Fujiko and will rescue her every time anyway. She's also known as one of the original [[Large_breasts|busty]] ladies of anime.

title: snack
body:
Any kind of light finger food consumed in between larger meals to satisfy hunger. [[Sweets]] covers sugary snacks, while [[dessert]] is for sweets served after a meal, usually dinner. Thus, this tag is for miscellaneous snacks like chips, popcorn, pretzels and crackers to name a few. Many snacks are identified on Danbooru, but if you cannot make out what snack(s) are in an image, this can be used as a catch-all tag.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: wonder_momo
body:
A beat 'em up arcade game that was released exclusively in Japan by [[Namco]] in 1987. 

The game puts the player in the role of the heroine of a (fictional) [i][[Ultraman]][/i]-type series.  Unusually, the setting is that of a live stage show, rather than the metafictional world of the show itself;  players are actually assuming control of [[Kanda Momo]], the actress who is supposedly portraying the heroine.  In addition to featuring a female protagonist at a time when this was rare, the game is notable for an element considered quite risqué for the time: Momo frequently has to avoid a photographer in the audience looking to take a [[pantyshot]], and she will become momentarily embarrassed (stunned) if he succeeds.

* Singer [[Momoi Haruko]] covers and cosplays as Wonder Momo for her album.
* For the video game [[idolmaster|IDOLM@STER]], Wonder Momo's costume is available for the girls to wear.

h4.See also

* "Wonder Momo wiki":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wonder_Momo

title: toushinden
body:
"Legend of Combat Arena Gods"

The very first 3D fighting game for the Playstation 1 platform, released in 1995. Toushinden is a primitive version of [[Soulcalibur]], utilizing weapons combat in a 3D field, but with the addition of [[Street Fighter]]-like special attacks that each character can use. The sidestep was also introduced in Toushinden, which Soulcalibur goes on to use.

In late 2009, a Toushinden game for the Wii was released, although its title uses slightly different kanji - 闘真伝.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_Arena_Toshinden

title: akaza_akane
body:
[[Yuru Yuri]]

[[Akaza Akari]]'s older sister, who is a university student and is 19 years old. She is secretly infatuated with Akari, often doing various perverted things with her belongings when she is not around.

title: furutani_kaede

title: ikeda_chizuru
body:
[[Yuru Yuri]]

[[Ikeda Chitose]]'s twin sister, who looks identical to her except for eye colour, but has a completely different personality. Similar to Chitose, she takes off her glasses and has [[yuri]] fantasies pairing Chitose with [[Sugiura Ayano]], albeit she drools instead of having nosebleeds. She has a love for Chitose while she dislikes [[Toshinou Kyouko]] as Kyouko constantly tries to play pranks on her and is seemingly a barrier against her fantasies.

title: sugiura_ayano
body: The [[tsundere]] student council vice-president in [[Yuru Yuri]]. She is often not too honest with her feelings for [[Toshinou Kyouko]] and always refers to Kyouko by her full name. As a dedicated student, she constantly sees herself as a rival to Kyouko, who always manages to beat Ayano in test scores. Ayano often makes puns on place names, causing a normally quiet [[Funami Yui]] to burst into laughter.

title: funami_yui
body: The cool-headed voice of reason in [[Yuru Yuri]]. She is a reliable and mature person who usually lives alone in an apartment complex, but actually feels lonely without anyone else around. Although generally quiet, she will sometimes burst into laughter upon hearing [[Sugiura Ayano]]'s puns. She is sometimes stressed by one of her childhood friends [[Toshinou Kyouko]]. [[Akaza Akari]] is also a childhood friend of her's.

title: kuroi_takao
body:
The president of 961 Production, as well as its producer. Like the other producers, he's not seen, but like the 876 Pro producer, is seen as a silhouette. After his original idols join with 765 Pro in The Idolmaster 2, he forms a new idol group called "Jupiter", formed by male idols. He is depicted as a cruel and ruthless businessman who will do anything, legal or not, to sell his idols and get ahead of 765 Pro and tell lies about them to his idols. He tends to treat his idols more like tools choosing the most appealing and talented rather than building their abilities, the complete opposite of [[takagi junjirou|Junjirō]]'s methods.

He and Junjirō were once old colleagues and friends, but later they had a falling out after Junjirō disagreed in the way Takao raised his idols. Since that incident, Takao has vowed to destroy Junjirō's company and his idols by any means necessary.

His company is actually named after him, as "961" is pronounced ku-ro-i in Japanese.

title: grandia
body:
Umbrella tag for all of the games in Game Arts' Grandia series. Grandia has notable features such as a battle system that allows enemy attacks to be canceled, as well as a rotational roster of characters not unlike what's seen in [[Final Fantasy IV]]. The series' main theme involves going on an adventure, whether it is an innocent quest at the beginning or saving the world in the end.

h4.Games

title: okazaki_ushio
body: Okazaki Ushio is a character from the visual novel/anime [[Clannad]]. She is the [[child|daughter]] of [[Okazaki Tomoya]] and [[Furukawa Nagisa]]. She has [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]], and is commonly depicted wearing a [[sailor dress]] and [[hat]].

title: furukawa_sanae
body:
Character from the visual novel/anime [[Clannad]]. Wife of [[Furukawa Akio]] and mother of [[Furukawa Nagisa]]. She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair|brown]] hair that sticks out like an [[antenna hair|antenna]] at the front and is tied into a [[ponytail]] with a blue [[hair ribbon]].

She runs a [[bakery]] with her husband, but her baking is of poor quality. It is a common gag for people (mainly her husband) to make negative comments about her [[bread]] unknowing that she is around to hear it.

Voiced by [[Inoue Kikuko]] in the anime.

title: furukawa_akio
body:
Character from the visual novel/anime [[Clannad]]. Husband of [[Furukawa Sanae]] and father of [[Furukawa Nagisa]]. He has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]], [[brown hair|brown]] hair that sticks out like an [[antenna hair|antenna]] at the front. He owns a [[bakery]] that also doubles as the Furukawa residence.

He often plays baseball with neighborhood kids in a nearby park, so he is sometimes seen carrying a [[baseball bat]] around.

title: fujibayashi_ryou
body:
Character from the visual novel/anime [[Clannad]]. She is the younger [[twins|twin]] sister of [[Fujibayashi Kyou]]. She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair|purple]] hair with a [[hair ribbon]] on the right side. She is timid and kind and is into fortunetelling.

In the After Story, Ryou becomes a [[nurse]].

title: ibuki_fuuko
body: Character from the visual novel/anime [[Clannad]]. She has yellowish brown eyes and grayish brown hair, though she is also sometimes drawn with black or green hair. She is fond of [[starfish]] and often carves them out of wood with a [[knife]]. She has an elder sister named [[Ibuki Kouko]].

title: sakagami_tomoyo
body:
Character from the visual novel/anime [[Clannad]]. She has [[blue eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[silver hair|silver]] hair, and wears a black [[hairband]]. She is known to have amazing [[kicking]] ability.

The popularity of the [[Okazaki Tomoya|Tomoya]]-Tomoyo pairing led to an official spinoff in [[Tomoyo After]].

title: okazaki_tomoya
body:
The main protagonist of the visual novel/anime [[Clannad]]. He has [[short hair|short]], steel [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. In the beginning, he is a  delinquent with a cynical outlook on life, due in part to his strained relationship with his father, [[Okazaki Naoyuki]]. However, he slowly improves thanks to his friends.

In the After Story, he gets married to [[Furukawa Nagisa]], and they have a daughter named [[Okazaki Ushio|Ushio]].

title: vaulting_horse
body: A common piece of equipment in Japanese gyms, often used to establish that the scene is in a [[gym storeroom]]. Frequently seen in Japanese media in a stacked form (where the number closest to the floor indicates the height) as compared to Western vaulting horses which are typically a padded bar raised on two metal bars and adjusted for height with screws.

title: candy_(smile_precure!)
body:
The mascot fairy of [[Smile Precure!]], voiced by [[Ootani Ikue]]. She was sent to Earth to find the legendary [[Precure]] to recover the Cure Decor and save Marchenland. In episode 8, she and [[Hoshizora Miyuki]] switch bodies, and Miyuki must transform into a variant of [[Cure Happy]] called [[Cure Candy]]. [[pop (smile precure!)|Pop]] is her older brother.

For her human form seen in episode 46, see [[Royal Candy]]. For fanmade human personas of her prior to ep. 46, see [[Cure Candy]].

For the tag referring to any general sweet confection or dessert, see [[candy]].
other_names: キャンディ(プリキュア)

A sexy, comedic fantasy anime and manga series known in English as "Sorcerer Hunters." The 13-volume manga, written by Akahori Satoru and illustrated by [[Omishi Rei]] from 1993-1998, was made into a 26-episode anime by Xebec, with Mashimo Koichi directing and character designs by [[Gotou Keiji]]. It tells the tale of a group of warriors who protect the populace from evil magicians.

h6. The Sorcerer Hunters

A kitchen designed around baking breads and confections is called a [[bakery]].

title: voyakiloid
body:
VOYAKILOID pertains to Fanmade [[Vocaloid|Vocaloids]] representing failure of purpose and failure of proper singing. This trend started when [[Caffein]] illustrated and drew inspiration from 2ch for the first character of this class of Vocaloids: [[Yowane Haku]]. Since then, other fans added to the family of Voyakiloids, deriving their personalities from none other than Haku herself, although this isn't the case all the time. Many official Vocaloids have a Voyakiloid equivalent. 


h6. Voyakiloids:

* [[Yowane Haku]]
** [[Yowaneko]]
* [[Honne Dell]]

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: watanabe_poemi
body: The main character of [[Puni Puni Poemi]], Watanabe Poemi is an insanely hyperactive girl with dreams of being a seiyuu. Ironically, she's voiced by Kobayashi Yumiko, who is already a famous seiyuu. This joke is further added by Poemi always calling herself 'Kobayashi'. She is the daughter of [[Nabeshin]] and Kumi-Kumi in an alternate universe to [[Excel Saga]]. With the powers of a magical dead fish (no, I'm not making that up), Poemi can transform into [[Puni Puni Poemi (character)|Puni Puni Poemi]] to protect the Earth from an alien invasion.

title: puni_puni_poemi_(character)
body: The transformed heroine form of [[Watanabe Poemi]] in [[Puni Puni Poemi]]. Poemi is the embodiment of the Earth's will, though she would rather punch holes in giant mecha and fling nuclear missiles around than be a traditional magical girl. Poemi actually becomes dangerous to Earth's citizens [spoiler]until she accidentally tells the Aasu sisters her identity.[/spoiler]

title: puni_puni_poemi
body:
An offshoot 2-episode anime to [[Excel Saga]], directed by Watanabe Shinichi. PPP is a parody of the magical girl genre while cramming as many sexual jokes, references to other shows, and overall insanity as possible within two episodes. In the opening segment, Puni Puni can be seen fighting several famous anime girls like [[Sailor Moon]], [[Kinomoto Sakura]], and [[Tenjou Utena]]. 'Puni' is also Japanese onomatopoeia for squishy skin, which is heard in the second episode.

h4.See also

* Wikipedia article: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puni_Puni_Poemy

title: black_cat
body:
A [[cat]] with black fur.

Black cats, in Japanese lore, are associated with good luck and are able ward off evil or cure illnesses in children. In Western lore, they are associated with bad luck and [[witch|witchcraft]].

For the manga by [[Yabuki Kentarou]], see [[Black Cat (series)]].

title: iczer-1
body: The eponymous character of [[Tatakae!! Iczer-1]]. She fights against her own race to protect Earth from domination.

title: eagle_vision
body: A commander of Autozam's army in [[Magic Knight Rayearth]]. Autozam invades Cephiro to conquer the fallen country. In the OVA, Eagle becomes the main antagonist who wants to destroy Earth because he believes that's what his sister [[emeraude (rayearth)|Emeraude]] wants.

title: mokona
body: A fluffy rabbit-like creature that first appears in [[Magic Knight Rayearth]] as the heroines' helper, and since reappears in various CLAMP series. He can only say "puu", and stores needed supplies in his forehead gem. He is named after Mokona Apapa, one of CLAMP's artists.

title: emeraude_(rayearth)
body:
In [[Magic Knight Rayearth]], Emeraude is the princess and pillar of Cephiro who supports the world with her prayers. The High Priest Zagato sealed her away so her prayers won't support Cephiro, so the Magic Knights are summoned to rescue her.

[spoiler]Or so they thought. Their real duty is to kill Emeraude because she loved Zagato and couldn't focus on supporting Cephiro.[/spoiler]

title: ferio_(rayearth)
body: A swordsman who comes across the three heroines of [[Magic Knight Rayearth]]. [[hououji fuu|Fuu]] doubts his motives at first, but over time they become a couple. In the OVA, Ferio becomes Fuu's adversary.

title: ascot_(rayearth)
body: A small boy who can control monsters like weapons, but treats them like his friends. In the OVA, Ascot directly becomes [[Ryuuzaki Umi]]'s enemy.

title: emma_hetfield
body: A minor character in the Playstation game [[Wild Arms 1]], and a playable character in its remake Wild Arms: Alter Code F. She also makes a cameo in [[Wild Arms 5]]. Emma is a professor who researches the ARMs and Golems. She is the one responsible for bringing [[Rody Roughnight]], [[Jack Van Burace]] and [[Cecilia Lynne Adelhyde]] together for their first mission, and Emma continues to provide missions throughout the story. She acts as a big sister figure for Rody once she learns he can use ARMs.
other_names: エマ・ヘットフィールド

title: hanpan
body: [[Jack Van Burace]]'s constant companion in [[Wild Arms]]. Hanpan is a smart-talking wind mouse who serves as the 'brains' to Jack's 'brawn'. He is supposedly a few hundred years old, but little is actually known about Hanpan or his species. He also serves as one of Jacks 'tools', and gets to be controlled for a very short period of time.
other_names: ハンペン(ワイルドアームズ)

title: jack_van_burace
body:
One of the three protagonists of the Playstation game [[Wild Arms]] and its Playstation 2 remake Wild Arms Alter Code F. He is playable in both games, and his constant companion is the wind mouse [[Hanpan]]. He also makes a cameo in [[Wild Arms 5]].

'Jack Van Burace' is an assumed identity; his real name is [[Garrett Stampede]], representing the Vambrace in the Fenril Knights of Arctica Castle. When the demons attacked Arctica Castle, Garrett was the only survivor and swore revenge, changing his name and becoming a drifter. He joins [[Rody Roughnight]] and [[Cecilia Lynne Adelhyde]] in fighting the demons and saving his would-be lover [[Elmina Niet]], who had become Lady Harken.
other_names: ザック・ヴァン・ブレイス

title: lord_of_nightmares
body:
"金色の魔王 (ロード・オブ・ナイトメア)":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?s_mode=s_tag&word=%28%E9%87%91%E8%89%B2%E3%81%AE%E9%AD%94%E7%8E%8B%20OR%20%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC%E3%83%89%E3%82%AA%E3%83%96%E3%83%8A%E3%82%A4%E3%83%88%E3%83%A1%E3%82%A2%20OR%20%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC%E3%83%89%E3%83%BB%E3%82%AA%E3%83%96%E3%83%BB%E3%83%8A%E3%82%A4%E3%83%88%E3%83%A1%E3%82%A2%29%20OR%20%28L%E6%A7%98%20%E3%82%B9%E3%83%AC%E3%82%A4%E3%83%A4%E3%83%BC%E3%82%BA%29 

The ultimate being who created the [[Slayers]] universe and at least three other worlds, of which [[Lost Universe]]'s setting is one of them. He/She is too great to be comprehended, and he/she is simply called the Golden King of the Sea of Chaos. His/Her power is so immense that only [[Lina Inverse]] is capable of wielding such power, and even then it's unstable.

title: xelloss
body: The self-claimed "Mysterious Priest" who first appears in Slayers NEXT as a sort of shadowing companion of [[lina inverse|Lina]] and her gang. He is later revealed to be a high-ranking Mazoku serving the Beast Lord Zelas Metallium. Xelloss is notorious for acting friendly and unfriendly at the same time, as well as being vague with his intentions (he isn't necessarily a liar - he just doesn't fully explain what he's up to). This irritates many people, especially [[Filia Ul Copt]].

title: sylphiel_nels_lahda
body: A girl who occasionally appears in the [[Slayers]] series. Sylphiel idolizes [[Gourry Gabriev]], but is also on good terms with [[Lina Inverse]] and her crew. Sylphiel is a powerful healer, but an utterly pathetic attack magician - her Flare Arrows resemble carrots.
other_names: シルフィール=ネルス=ラーダ

title: zelgadiss_graywords
body: A major protagonist in the [[Slayers]] series who used to be [[Lina Inverse]]'s enemy, but soon becomes a good friend. Zelgadiss was transformed into a chimera by the High Priest Rezo, and he is traveling the world to find a way to return to normal. He finds that being around Lina's entourage helps him find good clues. Zel is very rational and serious, and is a decent swordsman and spellcaster.
other_names: ゼルガディス=グレイワーズ

title: tracy_(toushinden)
body: A battle-hardened cop who joins the second [[Toushinden]] simply to fight powerful opponents. In the third tournament, she is partnered with Iwashiro Nagisa to battle the Organization, although their combat styles and personalities are vastly different. [spoiler]Here, Tracy discovers that another fighter named Rachel is her long-lost twin sister, who wants to kill Tracy because she had a better life than her.[/spoiler]

title: sailor_star_healer
body: The Sailor Senshi form of [[Yaten Kou]]. Her only attack is Star Sensitive Inferno, a lightning attack.
other_names: セーラースターヒーラー

title: sailor_star_maker
body: The Sailor Senshi identity of [[Taiki Kou]]. She has only one attack called Star Gentle Uterus, which is a light ball barrage.
other_names: セーラースターメイカー

title: sailor_star_fighter
body: The Sailor Senshi identity of [[Seiya Kou]]. She only has one attack called Star Serious Laser, a strong laser beam.
other_names: セーラースターファイター

title: sailor_kakyuu
body: The Sailor Senshi form of [[Princess Kakyuu]] seen only in the manga. Her attacks are based off of olive blossoms.

title: sailor_chibi_chibi
body: [[Chibi Chibi]] as a Sailor Senshi, sometimes called Sailor Chibi Chibi Moon. She doesn't have attacks of her own, but powers up [[Eternal Sailor Moon]]'s attack and is able to teleport the Senshi out of danger.

title: fish_eye_(sailor_moon)
body:
One of the Amazon Trio seen in the fourth season of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. He wears a blue bodysuit and is so [[androgynous]] that he is often mistaken for a girl... plus he has a thing for handsome men, so that doesn't help his case.

For the type of image composition, see [[fisheye]].

title: tomoe_souichi
body: [[Tomoe Hotaru]]'s father who is a scientist possessed by the Daimon Germatroid and leads the Death Busters. He agreed to the possession in exchange for saving Hotaru's life after a fatal lab accident.

title: wiseman_(sailor_moon)
body: The main villain of the second arc of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. His real name is Death Phantom. Appears as a heavily robed figure, but is actually a decayed skeleton who was once human.

title: queen_beryl
body: A major antagonist for the first season of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]].

title: umino_gurio
body: [[Tsukino Usagi]] and [[Oosaka Naru]]'s male friend, a very nerdy boy who will stand up for Naru when she's in trouble.

title: artemis_(sailor_moon)_(human)
body: [[artemis (sailor moon)|Artemis]] as a young human man with long white hair.

title: diana_(sailor_moon)_(human)
body: [[diana (sailor moon)|Diana]] as a young human girl.

title: garigarioreokun
body: See [[ringorenji]].

title: luna_(sailor_moon)_(human)
body: The human form of [[luna (sailor moon)|Luna]] when [[Sailor Moon]] granted her wish to temporarily be human in the second movie.

title: tsukino_kousagi
body: She is a girl from an alternate universe of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] called Parallel Sailor Moon. Kousagi is [[Tsukino Usagi]]'s second daughter who becomes Parallel Sailor Moon after meeting a nameless [[pink cat (bssm)|pink cat]].

title: luna-p
body: A toy version of [[luna (sailor moon)|Luna]] that follows the young [[Chibi Usa]]. She considers it her friend, and it can transform into various items for her with the chant 'Luna P Henge'. It's also used for the Sailor Senshi to communicate with [[Sailor Pluto]].

title: super_sailor_saturn
body: The powered version of [[Sailor Saturn]]; her uniform loses the star brooch and feathered shoulder pads, making her outfit the same as the rest of the super Sailor Senshi. This form grants her the defensive ability Silence Wall, which is powerful enough to deflect attacks from [[Sailor Galaxia]].
other_names: スーパーセーラーサターン

title: princess_saturn
body: [[Tomoe Hotaru]]'s identity as the princess of Saturn.

title: super_sailor_pluto
body: The super form of [[Sailor Pluto]]; her outfit changes to show her as a member of the planetary [[Sailor Senshi]]. Pluto mainly use Dead Scream in the anime, but she has other attacks in the manga such as Chronos Typhoon and Dark Dome Close. She can stop time as well, but at a great cost to her.
other_names: スーパーセーラープルート

title: princess_pluto
body: [[Meiou Setsuna]]'s identity as the princess of Pluto.

title: super_sailor_neptune
body: The super form of [[Sailor Neptune]]; her uniform is standardized to indicate she is part of the larger team of [[Sailor Senshi]]. Her two attacks remain the same in the anime (Deep Submerge and Submarine Reflection), but she uses an additional violin-based attack in the manga called Submarine Violin Tide.
other_names: スーパーセーラーネプチューン

title: princess_neptune
body: [[Kaiou Michiru]]'s identity as the princess of Neptune.
other_names: プリンセスネプチューン

title: super_sailor_uranus
body: The super form of [[Sailor Uranus]]; her uniform changes to reflect her position as an overall member of the planetary [[Sailor Senshi]]. Her two attacks (World Shaking and Space Sword Blaster) remain the same in the anime, but she gains a third attack called Space Turbulence in the manga.
other_names: スーパーセーラーウラヌス

title: princess_uranus
body: [[Ten'ou Haruka]]'s identity as the princess of Uranus.

title: queen_serenity
body: [[Princess Serenity]]'s mother during the Silver Millennium 1000 years prior to the series' events. She has long white hair, and her dress doesn't have circles on the top like her daughter's does. The bow on the back is tied to resemble a butterfly, which her daughter will emulate as [[Neo Queen Serenity]].

title: super_sailor_chibi_moon_(stars)
body: [[Sailor Chibi Moon]]'s final form seen only in the manga. Sometimes referred to as Eternal Sailor Chibi Moon.

title: super_sailor_mars
body: The super version of [[Sailor Mars]]. She gains the Mars Arrow for the attack Mars Flame Sniper. She still uses uses Burning Mandala and Fire Soul as the situation requires. She also still uses her ofuda to banish evil spirits with the phrase, "Akuryou taisan!"
other_names: スーパーセーラーマーズ

title: super_sailor_mars_(stars)
body: [[Sailor Mars]]' final form only seen late in the manga, sometimes called Eternal Sailor Mars.
other_names: エターナルセーラーマーズ

title: super_sailor_mercury
body: The super form of [[Sailor Mercury]]. She gains the [[Mercury Harp]] and uses the attack Mercury Aqua Rhapsody. She also uses Shine Aqua Illusion, but not Shabon Spray in the anime. For the special "Ami's First Love", she uses a one-time killer attack called Mercury Aqua Mirage.
other_names: スーパーセーラーマーキュリー

title: super_sailor_mercury_(stars)
body: [[Sailor Mercury]]'s final form only seen late in the manga, sometimes called Eternal Sailor Mercury.
other_names: エターナルセーラーマーキュリー

title: neo_queen_serenity
body: The future identity of [[Tsukino Usagi]] when she becomes ruler of Crystal Tokyo in 3000 A.D. and gives birth to [[Small Lady Serenity]]. Her outfit is slightly different from her past incarnation as [[Princess Serenity]]; her dress is more form-fitting to her curvature, and the bow on the back resembles butterfly wings. She also wears a crown and is somewhat more mature-looking.
other_names: ネオ・クイーン・セレニティ

title: matsuzaki_ginji
body: In [[Black Lagoon]], Matsuzaki Ginji is a legend among the Washimine clan of yakuza. Known as "Manslayer Ginji," his skill with the sword knows no equal. His primary weapon is a [[shirasaya]] blade which he uses to incredibly lethal effect, and such is his skill with the sword that he can even slice bullets in half in mid-flight. When [[Washimine Yukio]] finds herself caught in the middle of a power struggle between her syndicate and Hotel Moscow, it is Ginji who becomes her sworn protector.

title: washimine_yukio
body: In [[Black Lagoon]], Washimine Yukio is the heir of the Washimine Group, a yakuza clan that is suddenly without a leader. Yukio quickly finds herself caught in the middle of a deadly war between her yakuza rivals and Hotel Moscow, with treacherous elements within her own syndicate threatening to undermine her. Her sworn protector is [[Matsuzaki Ginji]]. When the Lagoon Company arrive in Japan, it is [[Okajima Rokuro]] who most sympathizes with her and seeks to free her from the life of crime, a mission that will cost him dearly.

title: watercolor_pencil_(medium)
body: Written「水彩色鉛筆」, water-soluble pigments packaged as a pencil, delivering the advantages of both [[colored pencil (medium)|colored pencil]] and [[watercolor (medium)|watercolor]] in being able to draw fine details and also to blend them with water.
